page.title: 12Coldharbour Library
page.content: Coldharbour library opened in November 1961.It has approximately 28000 books, 3500 adult members and 1000 junior members.There are three fulltime employees.Apart from books the library also loans story cassettes,audio visual kits,posters and has a range of leaflets available on such topics as local history and local information. The library also runs a mobile service and a service for housebound readers, which is operated by volunteers.The most popular books are romantic novels and crime stories.The library receives its books from the main library in Gravesend.Anyone living,working or studying in Kent may join.Books are issued for 4 weeks and each borrower may have 4 books at one time.There is no charge for membership,the tickets can be used at any library in Kent. Extra tickets are available for study.
